meanings.definition: To clothe or adorn oneself again.
meanings.sent1: After the rain stopped, she revested herself in her warm coat.
meanings.sent2: Every morning, he revested in his favorite t-shirt before heading out.
meanings.sent3: The superhero revested in their cape before going out to fight crime.
meanings.sent4: The tree revested in its vibrant leaves as spring arrived.
meanings.sent5: She revested in her confidence before stepping onto the stage.

meanings.definition: To invest again with a title or office.
meanings.sent1: The king revested his loyal advisor with the title of Duke.
meanings.sent2: The company revested the retiring CEO with an honorary position on the board.
meanings.sent3: The magician revested the rabbit with the title of 'Master of Disappearing Acts'.
meanings.sent4: The teacher revested the student council president with their leadership role.
meanings.sent5: The mayor revested the community hero with the key to the city.
